name: BEST WESTERN Kennedy Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This motel is clearly set up for the one night visitor who needs to connect to the airport. We stayed one night before going into the city to catch a train. The shuttle from the airport was great, as was the free hourly shuttle to the casino for dinner. There is nothing nearby the four airport hotels which are in a cluster away from anything. Room was small. However, the room safe did not work, the toilet clogged and we requested new sheets since the ones on the bed were stained and very shabby. They need to refurbish their linen. Staff were efficient and pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Small but OK for One Night

reviews.text: The room itself was clean and comfortable, but unfortunately it was right next to the breakfast area and lobby. Very noisy people kept me awake almost all night, I only slept 4 hours or so.
reviews.title: Room 216

reviews.text: It took 45 min for the shuttle to pick me up and 2 phone calls. The rooms are small and noisy. My toilet was running all night. Staff seemed more interested in talking to each other than to me. Don't think I would come back here unless there was no other choice.
reviews.title: Not The Greatest

reviews.text: 1. To start, we were visiting NYC for a wedding, we drove from Toronto , before leaving we called the hotel and asked if there was a possibility to get early check in on the rooms. They said yes for $25, they did not tell us however that there was a time restriction for when we could check in. Our travels put us a few hours ahead of schedule, less stops and different route. So we arrived at the hotel about 5am. When we tried to check in they would not let us and then told us we had to wait until 7am to do early check in. Or we could pay $100 for a room for 2 hours then pay $50 for early check in on the two rooms we had. Needless to say we were upset, and opted to sleep in the car for 2 hours.
reviews.title: ugh....

reviews.text: 2.We stayed on the 4th floor, we had 2 rooms on our 2nd night we came back and found ANTS in the bathroom.................. we were switched to a room upgrade on another floor, (which by the way took 30 min for them to figure out how to switch the rooms) .. but ANTS .
reviews.title: Just in case you miss your flight at JFK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel's clean rooms and friendly staff along with its proximity to JFK make it a great place to stay when you need a place close to the airport. The rooms were quiet, and the beds were comfortable. The free hotel shuttle from the airport was really convenient; but be aware that if you are without a car, there are very limited dining options. There is a free shuttle to the Resorts Casino next to Aqueduct Race Track where you can take advantage of the food court or the restaurants. The front desk can also give you information about places that will deliver to the hotel.
reviews.title: Close, Clean, and Friendly

reviews.text: I was laying over in NYC for little less than 24 hours and found this place on priceline.com. The hotel is not very expensive (for NYC rates), they have a shuttle from JFK (you will have to use the AirTrain from the terminals to the pickup/drop off point), breakfast included.
reviews.title: Accessible and Good hotel near JFK

reviews.text: I landed very late in the night and found it OK to reach the hotel with the AirTrain and Hotel shuttle. Rooms are clean, although not very spacious.
reviews.title: great, friendly staff, good for a layover

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this place if you have short stop over, commute to downtown NYC is less than an hour by the subway.
reviews.title: Hotel fine but Aircon a nightmare!

reviews.text: Budget hotel and delivers the value for money.
reviews.title: Close to airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel provides overnight accommodation for JFK airport and that is what you get - nothing more. We found the reception staff lackadaisical, and inclined to put us on perma-hold when we called before arriving. The room is a bit dingy and small, but clean. The AC was so noisy you could not sleep with it on. Luckily we could adjust the temperature and then turn it off. We left too early for the breakfast.
reviews.title: Just a bed for the night

reviews.text: Basically, it served its purpose, just, but nothing more.
reviews.title: horrible hotel staff; rude and unhelpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel seems a bit run down and is actually near a sanitation depot (lots of city garbage trucks) but besides a wet/ mildew smell in the rooms was pretty clean. The free breakfast was very nice, and the bed was extremely comfortable. However, I will NEVER be back to this hotel and the quality of service I received from the hotel reception staff (in particular a girl named Savi) was the WORST I have ever received in my life, and I am a pretty frequent international traveler. Check-in at this hotel starts at 3 pm, and I and another traveler arrived at 2:45 pm. After checking in one guest before my party she asked us to wait 5 minutes in the lobby, which we did. She preceded to chat with other hotel workers (not regarding hotel business) for 15 minutes, after which she checked in other guests who arrived after us. When I finally reached the front desk (after standing in line again) she checked us in without explaining the unnecessary wait (especially since she let other guests check in early without waiting... therefore I assume it wasn't a matter of getting our particular room cleaned before we could check in... it was 2:45 pm for chrissake!) and while she looked sheepish after realizing that she had checked in a bunch of others and could probably tell that I was pretty mad, she did not apologize for the extended wait. Overall very rude, unprofessional and very unhelpful. This experience has made me seriously question the extra money I paid for the Best Western name.
reviews.title: Only in an emergency

reviews.text: This property is almost a cliche, it is so bad. The room is VERY small (sort of a large closet), not very clean, badly worn out and seriously in need of a paint job! The bathroom door had a gash in it. It is supposed to be smoke free, but it reeked (hopefully of old smoke!) The only good thing is the reliable transportation to the airport so you can get in and get out as fast as possible.This is the worse Best Western we have ever stayed at, and we have stayed at some very nice properties. I think each is individually owned and in this case, the owners must milk it for every cent they can get and do not spend anything on maintenance. The staff were friendly and polite--so all was not lost. My recommendation: try somewhere else.
reviews.title: TERRIBLE service !

reviews.text: We arrived at Best Western JFK with our 2 young children and many suitcases prior to an overseas flight. The staff treated us terribly, they would not help us with the luggage despite several polite requests by us. Finally, the manager at the time solicited a specific price for the help and only then we got help loading our bags onto the shuttle (they would not help get the luggage from the room though). I cannot describe our feelings, with our 2 little children and in need of help and the entire staff at the time (several men and one woman) just standing and looking at us. Do yourselves a favor, stay away from this hotel !
reviews.title: Excellent Reception Support

reviews.text: We arrived late in the night to get a few hours sleep before our flight out of JFK. The check-in process took more than 1 hour. They found our booking but as it was a pre-paid booking and they could not figure out if it was paid or not. It was paid at time of booking, but their records were incomplete so they could not tell. They did not agree to let us use the rooms against a credit card while they sorted their mess. So, we ended up sitting 1 hour in the reception late at night with a less than helpful receptionist handling the problem. He even blamed us for slowing down other's check-in!
reviews.title: Slow service at reception

reviews.text: In the end they did conclude it was paid and let us have the room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My step mother and i went to New York for the weekend, we stayed at Best Western and i have to say it was a great hotel, very clean and the staff was amazing. Being a tourist i had tons of questions with regards to getting around, the staff members were very helpful and patient with me. I can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Parking Issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I made reservations at the Best Western Kennedy Airport with the idea that we would check in, leave the car and fly to Europe. On our return at night, we would take the Best Western shuttle from JFK to their hotel, spend the night and drive home the next day. It did not work out quite that way.
reviews.title: Very Handy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to the Best Western at JFK, went to the desk, paid for our parking and room. We had incorrectly assumed that offsite parking meant that the hotel would take care of our car. Wrong. We had to pay in advance and personally drive our car to the “Parking Spot” which is about a mile away crossing the Belt Parkway and a divided highway twice to get there. The people at the Parking Spot were courteous and helpful,took us to the airport and we made our plane on time.
reviews.title: Great hotel for an overnight layover

aka: Best Western Kennedy Airport Hotel Jamaica
description: Jamaica, New York March 2, 2013 – The BEST WESTERN Kennedy Airport in Jamaica, New York has received the Best Western Director’s Award for outstanding quality standards. The Director’s Award recognizes best Western hotels scoring in the top 20 percent of more than 2,100 North American properties in cleanliness and maintenance. Hotels must also meet best Western’s requirements for design and high customer service scores to qualify for the distinction.“The Director’s Award is an important symbol of success,” says General Manager Michael Williams. “This award confirms the BEST WESTERN Kennedy Airport commitment to providing quality accommodations for our quests. Our housekeeping and maintenance departments have worked hard to achieve this level of excellence.”
